title: 115_hr1226
content: The Act titled "Justice for Uncompensated Survivors Today (JUST) Act of 2017" requires annual reporting on Holocaust era assets and related issues. The Secretary of State must annually report on national laws regarding the return of Holocaust era assets and compliance with the 2009 Terezin Declaration. This includes returning wrongfully seized property or providing substitutes if return is not possible. The annual report must include the provision of substitute property or compensation to rightful owners, adherence to international principles on Nazi-confiscated art, restitution of heirless property for Holocaust survivors, enforcement of laws, and progress on asset return. The annual report must include progress on the resolution of claims for United States citizen Holocaust survivors and family members of Holocaust victims, as well as the effective date of inclusion in the report on human rights practices or international religious freedom report. The Secretary of State must include information required in new or existing reports, with deadlines set after the enactment of the Act. The term "appropriate congressional committees" refers to specific committees in the House of Representatives and Senate. The term "covered countries" includes countries that are signatories to the Terezin Declaration on Holocaust Assets and Related Issues and are determined to be of concern by the Special Envoy for Holocaust Issues. The term "wrongfully seized or transferred" includes various actions such as confiscations, expropriations, nationalizations, forced sales, and transfers during the Holocaust era or Communist rule in specific countries of concern.
